summary: This document is an email chain from January 28, 2020, discussing coordination for an interview with a victim/client in London related to the Epstein investigation. It involves a UK solicitor (Jill Greenfield), an NYPD/FBI detective, and FBI personnel, focusing on scheduling a call and confirming the victim's date of birth to determine her age at the time of relevant events.

persons.name: Jill Greenfield
persons.role: Partner at Fieldfisher law firm, representing a victim/client
persons.context: A UK solicitor who initiates contact to arrange an interview for her client, a victim of sexual assault in the UK, with US investigators. She asserts the client's right to anonymity under UK law.

persons.name: N. (NY) (FBI)
persons.context: An FBI agent in New York who is copied on emails regarding the Epstein investigation, provides the victim's date of birth (DOB), and declines to join an initial call due to being tied up with a separate case.

persons.name: W. (NY) (OGA)
persons.role: Detective, NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
persons.context: The initial recipient of Jill Greenfield's inquiry. A detective who coordinates with prosecutors from the Southern District of New York and proposes a call to discuss details for interviewing the victim.

connections.description: Greenfield, as a solicitor, is communicating with Detective W. to arrange an interview for her client with US investigators.
Greenfield is copied on emails with the FBI agent N., who provides the victim's DOB needed for the investigation.
Both are part of the law enforcement coordination for the Epstein investigation, with N. being copied on emails initiated by W.

events.title: Email coordination for victim interview
events.description: Email chain discussing the logistics of setting up an initial call and an interview with a victim of sexual assault in the UK, related to the Epstein investigation.

locations: Riverbank House, 2 Swan Lane, London EC4R 3TT (Fieldfisher office)
New York, NY (implied location of FBI/NYPD personnel)
keyFacts: A UK solicitor, Jill Greenfield, is representing a victim of sexual assault that occurred in the UK, who is a subject of interest in the Epstein investigation.
The victim is entitled to automatic anonymity under UK Statute as a victim of sexual assault in the UK, and does not waive that right.
US investigators (NYPD/FBI Task Force and SDNY prosecutors) are seeking to interview the victim in London and need her date of birth to determine her age at the time of relevant events.
The email chain shows active coordination between UK legal counsel and US law enforcement in early 2020 regarding victim testimony in the Epstein case.
